data.meta_description: G.H.O.S.T.: Ghost Hunter of Spooky Terminator (also known as G.H.O.S.T. or Ghostbusters 3 or Untitled Animated Ghostbusters Movie) is an upcoming computer-animated supernatural comedy film produced by Columbia Pictures, Sony Pictures Animation and Ghost Corps Inc and The Montecito Picture...
data.text:
This article features media from Sony Pictures or its subsidiaries that has yet to be released.

To prevent speculation, please add reliable sources to the unreleased media. Any information that is not backed up by citations may be removed.

G.H.O.S.T.: Ghost Hunter of Spooky Terminator (also known as G.H.O.S.T. or Ghostbusters 3 or Untitled Animated Ghostbusters Movie) is an upcoming computer-animated supernatural comedy film produced by Columbia Pictures, Sony Pictures Animation and Ghost Corps Inc and The Montecito Picture Company. The sequel to Ghostbusters (1984) and Ghostbusters 2 (1987) and the first animated film in the Ghostbusters film series as well as the third installment overal, it was directed by Jennifer Kluska and Chris Prynoski, written by Brenda Hsueh.

Plot[]

The movie is set to be from a ghost's perspective.

Cast[]

Charlie Day as Barry Venkman, Peter Venkman's son.

Brady Noon

David Babich

Ginnifer Goodwin

Patrick Warburton

Eddie Murphy

Billy Crystal

Bill Murray as Peter Venkman, Barry Venkman's father.

Production[]

In October 2015, Ivan Reitman announced that he was producing an animated film for Sony Pictures Animation, with Fletcher Moules attached to the project as both animator and director. The film will tell a story from the perspective of ghosts. The film will begin production following the completion and release of Ghostbusters: Afterlife. The project was reconfirmed in June 2022, with Jennifer Kluska and Chris Prynoski as directors and Brenda Hsueh as the writer of the film.
